pages.text: Parameteoraspis was a genus of osteostracan jawless fish that lived during the Early Devonian. Its remains have been found on the island of Spitsbergen in Svalbard, as well as on Prince of Wales Island in the far north of Canada. One of the largest known osteostracans, the head shield of Parameteoraspis measured up to about 35 - 40 cm (about 13.8 - 15.7 inches) in width.
